word_mean: 重新组织，重构，结构变换

sentence.Network_en: The changes in social work consequent upon reorganization have been considerable.
sentence.Network_cn: 重组引起社会福利工作发生了重大变化。

sentence.Network_en: Reorganization is necessary on the distributive side of this industry.
sentence.Network_cn: 就这个行业的配销方面来说，重组是必要的。

sentence.Network_en: All our efforts are pushing towards a reorganization of the prison system.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们正尽一切努力去整顿监狱系统.

公司重整（Corporate reorganization）（corporate reorganization）制度，在日本也叫公司更生制度，指陷入经营、财务困境，出现破产原因或有破产原因出现危险 …

entry.tran: 改组;改造;改编;重新安排
entry.def: To reorganize something or to reorganize means to change the way in which something is organized, arranged, or done.

example.ex: It is the mother who is expected to reorganize her busy schedule...
example.tran: 应该让母亲来重新安排自己紧张的日程。

example.ex: Four thousand troops have been reorganized into a fighting force...
example.tran: 4,000名士兵被重组成为一支战斗部队。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of imposing a new organization; organizing differently (often involving extensive and drastic changes);

sentences.sentence: "a committee was appointed to oversee the reorganization of the curriculum"
"top officials were forced out in the cabinet shakeup"

means.word_mean: 2. an extensive alteration of the structure of a corporation or government;

sentences.sentence: "after the takeover there was a thorough reorganization"
"the reorganization was prescribed by federal bankruptcy laws"

auth_sentence.content: A reorganization commission was to devise schemes for closing the less efficient pits and amalgamating the others.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: A reorganization commission was to devise schemes for closing the less efficient pits and amalgamating the others.

auth_sentence.content: Earlier in the week, CEO Brian Moynihan announced a reorganization of his management team, firing two high-profile executives.
auth_sentence.res_content: Earlier in the week, CEO Brian Moynihan announced a reorganization of his management team, firing two high-profile executives.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Earlier in the week, CEO Brian Moynihan announced a reorganization of his management team, firing two high-profile executives.

auth_sentence.content: The long-drawn bankruptcy proceedings have been inching towards a possible reorganization plan slated for later this year.
auth_sentence.res_content: The long-drawn bankruptcy proceedings have been inching towards a possible reorganization plan slated for later this year.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The long-drawn bankruptcy proceedings have been inching towards a possible reorganization plan slated for later this year.

means.word_mean: 改组;改编;重新制定;整顿

sentences.en: The general manager has planned a reorganization of the sales department.
sentences.cn: 总经理已经计划改组销售部。
